metadata.titel_preek: Sixteenth Sunday After Pentecost / Second Sunday After Pentecost

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God, whose inner nature is self-giving love, pursues and redeems a humanity that is fundamentally 'without health' and on the verge of self-destruction.

subject.identificatie: The Triune God (Father, Son, Holy Spirit)
tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The three-personed God... pours itself out for the other
He shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

object.identificatie: Redemption and Restoration of the 'Miserable Offender'

zender.identificatie: The Trinity (The nature of God as Love)
tekstueel_bewijs: The inmost being of God is a dynamic interrelatedness that pours itself out

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ (Incarnation) and the Holy Spirit; human 'glimmers' of love
tekstueel_bewijs: love that has become incarnate in history through Jesus Christ
That person has conveyed to you a measure of the love of God

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a 'Vast Primordial Catastrophe', Death, and Human Resistance
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a moral mistake but as a 'primordial catastrophe' and 'estrangement' that renders the human subject powerless.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and worship as a result of being saved.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (The 'Watchman')
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Honesty, Fear of the Lord, and Worship
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action (confession) is explicitly stated as being enabled by the prior reality of God's forgiveness.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God pursues us even beyond the grave
The Holy Spirit pours forth from that love
voorbeelden_mens_subject: the psalmist is enabled to raise up his eyes

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
knowledge that he and everyone else is a 'miserable offender'
total inability to present ourselves righteous
the God who can redeem humanity

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) met by God's 'pouvoir' (sovereign power to save).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the 'Depths' (S2) through the negation of human merit (~S1) to the discovery of Grace (S1) which creates a new 'Fear of the Lord'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: God's mercy is the only bridge from S2 to S1; human effort is a 'dead end'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is described as a 'primordial catastrophe'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon consistently places God as the active Subject and humanity as the desperate, incapable Receiver. It explicitly rejects moralism and 'point-keeping'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: None found; grace is 'not dependent on the worthiness of the other'.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of active verbs
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God pursues us even beyond the grave with his resurrection power.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Paul is used as an analogy for God's parental heart, not as a moral hero to imitate.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Paul (as a window into God's desperation)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Paul's love is a 'glimmer' of God's love.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'renewed confidence' through the external word of the Gospel.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation; God does the work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'miserable offender' to the 'redeemed' is logically and theologically seamless.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: redeem humanity from so grave a predicament; breaking through our resistance

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'fellowship' that sustains the believer in the 'last ditch'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of grace-oriented narrative structure. God is the Subject, the human is the Receiver, and the Opponent is insurmountable by human means.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Gospel.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully maintains the 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the primary actor even when discussing human confession.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the parental metaphors, Greimasian analysis reveals that these metaphors function to reassign the 'Subject' role to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Trinity; semiotics shows how the Trinity *acts* upon the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Fear of the Lord' is a modal competence (Savoir/Pouvoir) granted by the Sender, not a work produced by the Subject.

appendices.notities: The sermon explicitly defends the 'no health in us' clause, reinforcing the structural necessity of a Divine Subject.
